main event: A report of a 'flying disc' over Riverdale, Chicago, on 7 August 1950, described as traveling very high and very fast by witnesses.
interesting points: The report was investigated with negative results, with no identifying data available and no photographic evidence.
Witnesses were unable to furnish further details concerning the incident, and no further investigation was contemplated by the headquarters.
The 'flying disc' was described as too round to be an airplane and traveling too fast to be a balloon.
The document is related to Project Blue Book, a United States Air Force program to investigate unidentified flying objects (UFOs).
The report was prepared by a local intelligence officer and addressed to the Commanding General at the Wright-Patterson Air Force Base.
